abstract: Toby Keith discusses his new song, "Made in America," his frustration at wrongly being labeled a Republican and his love for his grandmother and the songwriter Roger Miller.
snippet: Toby Keith discusses his new song, "Made in America," his frustration at wrongly being labeled a Republican and his love for his grandmother and the songwriter Roger Miller.
lead_paragraph: Toby Keith has mellowed somewhat since the turbulent days after Sept. 11, 2001, when he became most known for his jingoistic songs supporting the troops in Iraq and Afghanistan. On recent albums he has shied away from patriotic material in favor of more soulful ballads, along with the well-made songs he has always produced about drinking, chasing girls, breaking up and living hard.

headline.main: Q. and A. With Toby Keith
